item.title: Senior Analytics Consultant
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

In this position, you will be a key member of the Group Retirement Services (GRS) Finance team; supporting the development of Client metrics reporting and accompanying financial measures.  Collaborating with peers and leaders across the Canadian business unit data centres, you will be responsible to design, create and evolve our data analytics platform to accelerate the development of reporting, insights and strategic initiatives for drivers of cash flows, churn, revenue generation and profitability.  Successful candidates will possess more than 5 years of practical experience developing insightful reports/dashboards, drawing actionable recommendations from insights and demonstrate an ability to communicate effectively with senior leaders and other stakeholders. The role requires creative problem-solving ability, excellent communication and presentation skills, a willingness to try new techniques, and the ability to handle several diverse and concurrent projects.

This role reports to the Director, Business Analytics.

What will you do?

Analytics & Business Insights

  • Support the development of Client metrics reporting processes, benchmarking and visualization to provide insights to stakeholders, by leveraging multiple data source systems and integration layers, using a variety of tools and programming languages

  • Act as a subject matter expert or technical team lead on projects, ask questions and develop hypotheses, apply descriptive statistics, diagnostic techniques to answer business questions

  • Apply financial business knowledge to improve the economics of key drivers in the highest value areas

  • Ability to draw out business insights from analytical output and work with team leads to put together effective presentations of actionable insights and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders

  • Maintain standards for analysis and reporting at all levels including best practice data visualization techniques

Data Management & Integrity

  • Provide expert guidance to design, develop, maintain and continuously improve various SAS databases to enable accurate, reliable and timely data to support analytics, modeling, reporting, visualization and dashboards/KPI’s

  • Ensure all processes preserve data integrity by managing the alignment of data availability and integration processes

  • Data discovery - Liaison with IT and other analytics teams to scope new data sources, understanding and leveraging of current data sources for revenue generation, member and Client insights

  • Comply fully with all privacy, confidentiality, do not contact, SLF Code of Business Conduct, data security, and other requirements related to customer data

What will you need to succeed?

  • Minimum of Bachelor degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent experience.  MBA or post-grad degree in data analytics an asset

  • 5+ years demonstrated experience working with data, including transformation and manipulation, using a variety of data analysis methods

  • 5+ years intermediate to advanced knowledge in SQL, SAS

  • Advanced user of Excel with extensive financial modeling experience

  • 2+ years experience using Tableau

  • Must be able to effectively communicate (written and verbal) complex results to a business audience not familiar with complex data and analytics   

  • Ability to automate/develop complex reports &/or produce dashboards & scorecards & able to propose solutions to data issues

  • Ability to build partnerships and develop relationships with a variety of stakeholders

  • Good working knowledge of basic data warehousing concepts

  • Good working knowledge of presentation software such as PowerPoint

  • Proven ability to work well independently, but also function in a team environment, with frequent contact with people at all levels of the SLF Canada organization

  • Proven balance of analytical and creative problem-solving skills

  • Able to think with agility in meeting business partners\' demanding deadlines

  • Ability to move with minimum effort from detailed diagnostic thinking to higher level, opportunity-oriented thinking and to integrate the best from both into contributions and deliverables

What will be nice to have?

  • Knowledge of the DC recordkeeping business

  • Experience with AWS and Spark

  • Experience with analysis of unstructured data

  • Experience gathering and integrating external data with internal data

Unique Requirements

Must be able to obtain Reliability Status through the Government of Canada before a start date can be confirmed (includes a background check with fingerprinting by the RCMP).

To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (http://iss-ssi.pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca/msi-ism/ch2-prt1-eng.html) ​

 What\'s in it for you?

  • 20 vacation days per year

  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • A ‘dress for the day’ dress code, where you dictate how you dress based on your day

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted.  It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.  In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance.  Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results. 

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

item.title: AVP, Analytical Decision Engines
item.description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Client Experience Office (CXO) aims to provide a holistic "One Sun Life" experience to Clients as we help them achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives. We design and execute clear, compelling, caring journeys to help Clients navigate some of the most important moments of their lives. Through personalized, proactive and relevant content, we act on a deep understanding of Client needs on a multitude of communication channels—so we can be there for Clients when and where they need us.

To understand our Clients, we actively listen and learn by employing experts in Client experience, engagement, marketing, strategy, and digital, data and analytics. Our Client Solutions Centre (CSC) engages directly with plan members to ensure they maximize the value of their benefit and retirement plans.

What will you do?

Reporting to the VP Analytics and Insights, Client Experience Office, the Associate Vice President (AVP) Analytics Decision Engines will lead the creation, implementation and evolution of data-powered  decision engines that provide recommendations and insights to clients through prescriptive analytics.

The AVP will oversee a team of around 14 people (located in Toronto and Waterloo).  This executive will leverage data analytics to identify/develop sales and service opportunities to deepen client relationships and to drive strong client satisfaction scores, high client retention, and profitable growth for Sun Life.

A key responsibility of this role is to lead the evolution of Sun Life’s autonomous prescriptive analytics, including “Next best Action” algorithms implemented in automated, machine learning platforms. Proven practical experience in this area is an important requirement for this role.

Key priorities for this role are as follows:

Lead the development of the “Next Best Action” recommendation engine across all client touchpoints:

  • Lead the design, architecture and delivery of client engagement and recommendation platforms, including the evolution of autonomous prescriptive analytics

  • Conceptualize and implement a model to translate value of different potential real-life actions (outbound call, send e-mail,  digital nudge) into a quantifiable measure that can be used by machine-learning systems to prioritize decisions based on propensity and expected impact

  • Work closely with the Client Engagement team assessing performance of the recommendation and continuously evolving the platform, including expansion to more business units, products and touchpoints

Lead the development of the “smart assignment” analytical models to optimize matching of leads to the best suited advisors:

  • Work closely with the Client Acquisition team to define the strategy and the key factors to be taken into account in matching algorithms

  • Derive insights from the matching data to identify other potential success drivers and continuously work to improve performance of the engine

  • Identify other areas of opportunity where the engine can be applied to increase recommendation success

Embed rigorous performance management practices:

  • Proactively develop and track metrics and measures to evaluate and determine the effectiveness of marketing programs, customer offers, etc.

  • Leverage data/analytics to ensure that strong financial/commercial management practices are in place, through the efficient allocation of marketing spend across initiatives based on ROI.

What do you need to succeed?

  • Over ten years of data analytics experience, with a minimum of 3 years in a management/leadership role related to prescriptive analytics

  • S/he understands statistical and machine-learning techniques, including data preparation methods such as transformations, normalization, and modeling methods including linear and nonlinear regression techniques (applied to customer and sales analytics).

  • The successful candidate will have a strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.

  • Financial services industry experience is preferred but not essential

  • The successful candidate will be a strategic, conceptual thinker with strong written and oral communications skills who is able to influence the opinion of others.

  • S/he will have demonstrated the ability to operate in a highly matrixed environment, influencing and leveraging resources that do not report to her/him directly, and possess strong interpersonal skills

Proven experience in prescriptive analytics and machine learning:

  • Design and architecture: Ability to conceptualize prescriptive analytics from identification of data requirements to design of solution

  • Delivery and results tracking: Experience in implementation of operational prescriptive analytics models, tracking of results and continuous improvement of model performance

  • Proven track record implementing “Next Best Action” models and machine-learning algorithms

Strong quantitative, analytical and technical skills:

  • Strong quantitative background: Has impressive intellectual acumen and well-versed in key quantitative and data-driven disciplines as statistics, mathematics and finance

  • Robust understanding of data sufficiency and hypothesis-driven approach: Knows how to formulate hypothesis, design and run controlled tests to be able to conclusively identify significance in results, proving or refuting hypothesis

  • Broad understanding of different data & analytics methodologies and tools, including SAS, Open source (Python, AWS, SageMaker) and autonomous analytics (machine-learning)

Leading Teams:

  • Building talent: A proven leader able to build, lead, motivate and retain high performing teams. Insightful about the talent the organization needs to be successful; recruits and develops people with this in mind. Uses multiple methods to grow capability in the organization. Skillfully coaches and mentors others.

  • Inspiring and motivating: Gets the best performance from people. Taps into people’s needs, interests and goals to motivate them to achieve. Inspires commitment from people and mobilizes teams toward high performance and goal achievement.

  • Integrity: Adheres to the highest standards of personal and professional integrity and sets a positive example for others.

What’s in it for you?

  • Being a member of the Sun Life family, a group of people united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives

  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture

  • Joining a reputable organization with over 150 years of history

Job Description:

As one of Sun Life Canada’s largest business units, Insurance Solutions is responsible for designing and distributing leading-edge life and health insurance products to over 2 million individual retail clients across Canada.

Reporting to the Director, Business Intelligence, the Data Analyst will play an integral role in assembling the necessary data products to fuel a myriad of business intelligence reporting and advanced analytics initiatives within Insurance Solutions.

The ideal candidate is a challenge-seeking, intellectually curious analytics professional with a deep passion for turning data into actionable insights to drive business decisions and solving data challenges in new and innovative ways.

What will you do?

  • Analyze large quantities of data, draw out business insights from analytical output, and work with team leads to put together business recommendations
  • Assemble datasets to support various business intelligence, advanced analytics, data exploration, and self-service analytics initiatives within Insurance Solutions
  • Build the data infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and integration of data from disparate data sources using SQL and cloud-based big data technologies
  • Update data models to reflect the key business entities within Insurance Solutions
  • Assist in design of new solutions and strategies for data capture, processing and consumption across data platforms (relational, dimensional, and NoSQL) that meet the needs of a variety of consumption patterns (visualization, analytics, and machine learning)
  • Oversee and govern the expansion of our existing data architecture and the optimization of data query performance via best practices
  • Collaborate with IT partners and other analytics teams within Sun Life Canada to build out the data environment and analytics work platforms

What do you need to succeed?

  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Business, or equivalent
  • 2+ years of data analysis experience, including data extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a variety of sources
  • Experience writing efficient and complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources
  • Understanding of modern data management principles (e.g. data warehousing) with hands-on relational, dimensional, and/or analytic experience (using RDBMS, dimensional, NoSQL data platform technologies, and ETL and data ingestion protocols)
  • Experience using one or more statistical programming languages (Python/R/SAS) to work with data sets
  • Experience with data visualization tools, specifically Tableau
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to work independently and in close collaboration with technical and business teams

What will be nice to have?

  • Hands-on experience working on cloud platforms (AWS) with data processing and analytical tools such as AWS SageMaker, Apache Zeppelin, Hive SQL, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, etc.
  • Familiarity with the Individual Insurance industry

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
  • A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
  • Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
  • Flexible Benefits from the day you join to meet the needs of you and your family

Job Description:

Role Summary

Within Sun Life Canada, the Canadian Analytics Centre of Excellence (COE) was launched to support Canadian business units in their journey to leverage data and analytics as a foundational pillar in delivering business value.

Reporting to the Director, Analytics Consulting Services as a Senior Data Scientist you will focus on supporting Canadian business units in accelerating the growth and application of analytics in driving value.  The senior data scientist will leverage practical experience in applying varied data science techniques & offering advice/inputs to help with the design, development and implementation of analytics use cases.

Sun Life views success in this role in demonstration of these key attributes:

Fierce curiosity. You are drawn to discovering and leveraging new data and taking on challenging business puzzles. An inquisitive mind. Driven to ask questions to help lead projects to commercial value and not being afraid that the innovation attempts can and will lead to failing. A passion for solving problems.  The most successful data scientists’ solution for what the right data to use, they solve using the most suitable (not most advanced) algorithms for the problem at hand and figure out how to execute and deliver with highest efficiency. Technical skills in both data and computer science. There are 3 core technical skills we look for: in-depth coding knowledge of an analytical tool(s) (i.e., Python); data science techniques and concepts; working with structured data (SQL) Thirst for learning. You are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.

What will you do?

  • Apply best in breed data science including descriptive, predictive, machine learning, deep learning and AI techniques from the design to implementation that impacts the business.

  • Focus on Feature Engineering, Model Training and Model Evaluation in addition to data munging / wrangling

  • Identify the right algorithms and statistical techniques for a specific project as well as the best features for a model.  Advise junior members on the same.

  • Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders

  • An active contributing member to the analytics community to help foster and grow the data science community at Sun Life

  • Champion and support diversity and inclusion

What will you need to succeed?

  • 2+ years experience in developing and implementing data science techniques (predictive, prescriptive, ML etc.)

  • Comfortable writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources

  • Proficient in using one or more statistical programming languages (i.e., Python) for data science

  • Big Data Technologies: Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, Kafka

  • Experience with deep learning methodologies either in practice or in academia

  • Effective and concise oral and written storytelling and insights communication skills

  • Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and priorities

  • Ability to document work and effectively prioritize documentation

  • BSc/M.S. in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field (i.e., computer science) or equivalent experience

What will be nice to have?

  • Past experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)
